page.title: 01Ivington Common Area
page.content: This area includes the small villages of Monkland and Ivington together with the tiny parish of Stretford and surrounding lands. It is a lowlands area rising very gently from the valleys cut by the River Arrow and its tributaries into gently sloping open farmland. it is a fertile, agricultural area. The farmland is predominantly arable with variety f crops being grown, wheat, barley, oats, potatoes and root crops. There is also a considerable amount of intensively managed grassland sown and cut for silage and occasionally for hay,as well as being used for grazing cattle The main occupation of the area is farming or work connected with the farming industry.People living in this area would commute to either Leominser or Hereford using the A4112 or the A 4110 which serve the area along with
